Senior Product Designer - Client Platform

at Spotify in Stockholm, Sweden from 2/21/2021

Client Platform, a tribe in Platform Mission, is focused on mobile and client engineers. We are looking for a Senior UX Product Designer that can help us understand the needs of our customers and elevate design practices throughout the tribe. The teams you will work with are still learning how to work with UX, but there is widespread curiosity and willingness to try out new methods and ways of working.

Responsibilities

Work with multi-disciplinary teams made up of engineers, product managers, data scientists, and more.
Together with your cross-functional partners, you’ll set the vision for the user experience and create the space for others to collaborate. You’ll help foster a shared understanding of the problem space by facilitating cross-functional workshops and group ideation sessions.
You have a people-focused design mentality; you are constantly looking to hone your design instinct through user feedback. Whether through hands-on user research, or by designing options for an A/B test.
Be autonomous. You’ll drive progress through obstacles by building consensus and making decisions – taking responsibility for every last detail, every step of the way.
Take into account existing insights, technical constraints, business needs, and specific platform demands to produce data-informed solutions that consider problems from multiple angles.
Evolve the design practices in the tribe by evangelizing, coaching and mentoring others. You’ll provide teams with the methods, processes, and solutions needed to execute strategy.

Skills

You’re a fantastic team player, communicator and facilitator. You have the communication skills and people-focused design mentality to help set up frameworks and brainstorm initial design concepts.
You have a people-focused design mentality and want to design and build products/features that truly have meaningful impact.
You are experienced in conducting user research and usability testing, and turning the output into data that can drive product design decisions.
You are data driven and use quantitative as well as qualitative data sources to inform your design decisions.
You have a strong understanding of and experience in Lean and Agile UX processes, and are not afraid of suggesting new ways of working.
You have experience with Enterprise UX and/or B2B products, or internal facing products.
You have 5+ years of relevant work experience, for example as a Product Designer.
You have an online portfolio, or a PDF that you can share with us and you are able to provide a brief explanation in your application of why you are excellent for this role, while highlighting your portfolio.
